And yes, the story got lost in the history. I too anticipate the next one, but hope Diana will get back to letting history support the story, instead of the other way 'round.

this series has not slowed, become boring or lost its magic. you get a little from 1980s and the 1770s. my head is spinning with all the drama. I am almost afraid to start the last book. I don't want it to be over. I am still smitten by Jamie and Claire. their love transcends all the evil in their world. they don't make men like Jamie Fraser anymore.

The entire book was such an unexpected series of events that I was enthrall the entire way through.  As much as I hate cliffhangers when the next book is not available, I have to say these are well done.  After the slower A Breath of Snow and Ashes which was enjoyable for it's slower pace this book was a great come back.  Can't wait for the next one.

I really enjoyed this book, probably more than the preceding novel.  I have been left with many loose ends to hold on to until later this year (2013).  I felt this novel had all the makings I look for in a book:  strong characters, happiness, sadness, loss and gain.  It made emotions emerge and that point of really feeling a book is important to me.
Another great book from the Outlander series. I am always so sad when the book ends and was especially sad at the end of the series.
Brilliant..couldn't put it down until it was finished. Cliff hanger finish...
Another great book by Diana  Gabaldon.
While I love Diana Gabaldon .,I found this book boring, and drawn out. I could not concentrate, because I found it confusing.
I could go on reading about Clair and Jamie's life forever!
I got hooked from the beginning
All Diana Gabaldon books are great and I would recommend them to anyone Haven,t used  this site before would only rate if i found them great.
thoroughly enjoyed the story. How it weaves in and out of the historical to the present. Great read though it took me a while.
This is another Outlander novel. Love the twists and turns. A real page turner. Can't wait till 10th June for the next book

I really liked this book, I know it has a lot of Roger and Bree in it and also William but it is all part of the continuing story and we meet a new love interest for Ian and a loved character is lost. It has a lot of course, about Jamie and Claire too and no character that we feel should be there is left out!  I learned a lot about the war of independance to boot!

I throughly love Diana's writing.  She puts you right in the middle of history and makes you feel like you are right there with these people.  This is the fifth book I have read of hers.  I just love these books. This book has some dry areas but it is still a good read.

This is my favourite of the American side of Jamie and Claire's story. Unlike the fiery cross (yawn) this story kept me gripped with intrigue and excitement. I had hoped to read it much slower so as to shorten the gap between this story and Written in my own hearts blood (released in June 2014). I thoroughly enjoyed reading more about Ian, now a grown man, falling in love no less, and the re introduction of the Murray's of Lallybroch. As always, it is easy to be captivated by Diana Gabaldon's descriptions of people and the world around them, thankfully not to overly detailed in this book, but I always enjoy being transformed to the Colonies and Scotland. If you have been feeling bored by previous books, this one will not disappoint...enjoy :)

I now have to wait until Jun and his is only March.  These books are so amazing in that every time is read them I am transported to another time and place.  Yes I think that time travel is real when I am reading these books!
I LOVE THIS BOOK. CONSTANT ACTION .  I LOVE HEARING WHAT ALL THE CHARACTERS ARE UP TO, AS I'VE READ ALL OF THE DIANA GABALDON SERIES.

Well, now I feel like I have lived through at least part of the American revolution!  It really is like living history, and of course our old familiar characters live up to expectations while under duress.  It ends with a real cliff-hanger, insuring that any who read it will most definitely be waiting for the next one in a few months.  I know will!

Really enjoyed this book. Set at the beginning of the war of Independence I liked reading about the lives of ordinary people as well as the main characters. The main characters are, as in the other books of the series, capitivating to follow.
Ever sinds I read the first in this series  I have been hooked, can't wait to read the next one.
i love the Outlander series and am longing for the next issue to be published. i would highly recommend this whole series
I greatly enjoyed this addition th the series. It just keeps on developing and more exciting things happesn. The most frustrating thing is waiting for the next installment.
I loved this book when I first read it and look forward to re-reading it in preparation for reading MOBY
It's a great book as usual. I  wouldn't expect anything more from Diana Gabaldon.  Looking forward to the next one.
I loved this book. The only disappointment was when it ended...I wanted to keep on reading. I can't wait for the next one. Dianne
couldnt put it down from start to finish. Cant wait for her to write the next one- hope it's due out soon!
RIGHT FROM THE FIRST BOOK I WAS HOOKED INTO THIS SERIES.  I COULD ASSOCIATE WITH AND FEEL FOR MANY OF THE CHARACTERS THAT I JUST WANTED TO SPEAK WITH THEM, BE WITH THEM.
I just can't get enough of Jamie & Claire. Especially Jamie's endearing comments to Claire. Just can't seem to put them down when I start.
Another great book, so easy to read via Kindle.  The hard copy is such a big book and so heavy.

I have read all the Outlander series - loved the first, 2 and 3 were disappointing.  I felt they were just filling in to get to America.  The Carolina ones were good.  But this is back to Scotland, and I loved it.
I Just love this whole series and can't wait for the next book to be released some time this year
I really love this whole series and can't get enough. I didn't want this book to end and read really slowly.
Well, NOTHING but NOTHING will ever beet Cross stitch for me but they follow on so well you just have to keep going to see what happens

This is the last book in the series, I have been reading these books over a very long period, I love the history that Diana brings into her books Ihave just started this one so far it is very hard to put down. I had my Kindle bought for me for Christmas so am able to read my book anywhere
Love Diana's book. Cannot get enough of them. Truly Fantastic story. Her writting is superb. I have learned so many new words.
One of best books ever. Passionate, romantic, adventurous, dangerous and riveting. Could not put it down. Could not put any of the outlander series down!!

An Echo in the Bone is an enjoyable read. I finished the book and immediately looked to see when the next Outlander installment will be released. As usual, Ms.Gabaldon leaves us surprised and itching to read her next book.

Diana Gabaldon's series of Outlander/An echo in the bone shows imagination beyond the everyday.  The story starts with the far-fetched notion of stepping between stones in Scotland and finding yourself in the midst of the Jacobean Revolution.  I have 3 degrees in science, but I bought into the strong story line and loved every minute of my suspended reality.
I would recommend reading thesee books in order. I have become an addict and am looking forward tofinding the next in the series due out this year
Another fantastic read from Diana. Left me hanging for the next one. Loved learning more about some characters only touched on in the previous books.
Interesting, fast moving, lots of things happening, all set in a previous century with the added spice of time travel

I loved this last book in the Outlander series as much as the others, so much attention to detail and so many new story lines coming up. I want to keep reading about all the people in the series as Jamie and Claire are getting older it is time for others to have adventures before it gets more of the same. I love how Diana goes from one story to the other and just can't wait to read what will happen next, there are a lot of open endings in this book! Please hurry up with the next one Diana, it has been quite some time now and I have just reread all the novels again. I've been living in the 18th century for weeks now and just can't get enough.
fantastic enjoyed every page read it twice and will go back for a third and enjoy it equally I am sure.
I recommend the whole Outlander serie. I liked this one as much as I loved all the others. I can't wait for the sequel.

Diana has the gift of making history into breath taking life story. One has the notion of not wanting the read to end. I have followed this writer from the journeys beginning and will be an ardent follower until the the tale is told. I eagily wait to follow the unfolding lives bound so deeply in this historical adventure.
I love the whole series!  I've read it multiple times. Takes me away like a holiday. Start at the beginning with Oulander and enjoy the journey.

I am not enjoying this book as much as the others, I think that it is very slow and there are no real "bones" to the story.  I am still a fan of the "Jamie and Claire" saga but would like to see a bit more action in future books.  I have found the the tooing frooing between William and Lord John a bit boring to be honest

This book, as all the other books of this author are absolutely fantastic.  I have and will continue to recommend the Outlander Series to friends and family.  There is an amazing story line to the writings of Diana Gabaldon.  Can't wait for the next book..

Really enjoyed the Outlander series. When i started a new book i couldn't put the book down until i saw the ending.I was wondering if the series will continue and if so when will the new book be released.

If you read and liked the six books prior to this story, you will delight in this latest tale. I devoured this book and feel like I know these people so well. I don't give five stars easily but when an author takes such care and respects her readers so obviously and deliciously, I am compelled to render that author a five star writer. Magnificent!

I am such a fan and have read them all several times, but when this one us done I need more.  Thank goodness there is now another.  Diana's gift is that her characters never cease to amaze as the story unfolds full of shocking surprises and adventure.  As one character wanes, the others step up in this constant heart thumping story.  Great read!

As an ardent fan who will follow Jamie anywhere, I have to acknowledge that some of this saga has slowed down in places. But now, the story comes alive again and we are off again, fully engaged, interested, hoping, anxious, excited, and wanting MORE. So much so that I don't let the problematic editing get in the way. Can't wait for the next book

Please see my review for Drums of Autumn-- this is also the same series and I did that review for all of the books in the series actually.  This is Book 7 of 7. and I can tell you -- I -and her millions of other fans are clamoring and begging her to continue writing more- even if we have to supply her with a new computer to do so as a bribe! :-)

If you read the first book of the series and you are unsure about going on with the rest, it's OK; you read a fine story, had a great time, fine. If you went on to the second book, you are bound to read the third. But as you continue, because you've made a bond to the characters or whatever reason, you sometimes wonder if it was worth the time.

I enjoyed these books so much the second time around!  The only book I read more than once is the Bible.  I think I devoured the Outlander series so fast the first time I couldn't savor the details like I did this time reading on the Kindle.  It's so much easier to see and you don't have to hold the heavy book!  I feel like I know these people!

Loved it !  But, for the first time, Ms. Gabaldon left us with a cliff hanger!  Which, of course, is driving me crazy!  So.....I have to wait until June of this year to find out what happened to Roger, Brianna and Jem !?!  Even the preview of the next book did not answer those questions!  The preview only left me with MORE unanswered questions!

An Echo In the Bone has multiple parallel story lines all of which are ultimately circular back to Jamie and Claire.  Each story line will keep you turning the pages as fast as you can to find out what is going to happen next.  I highly recommend you have Book 8 ready to read when you finish with Book 7, because you will not want to delay.

I love the love Jamie and Clair have for each other and there day to day struggles. The author has done an excellent job with the time period, always looking forward to the next read. Only negative thing I would say is how much can two people really experience in there lifetime, but the author has a way of drawing you in for the next book.

I do love all her books, I re-read this one so I could jump into the next one with a clear head. But I have found a novella about Joan, Jamie's stepdaughter that actually takes place near the end of this book, so I think I'll read it first, a The Space Between. Anyway you will not be disappointed with this book at all, another great read.

This is the 7th book, and I am so upset that there isn't another one to jump right in to!  So much happens in this one, altho it does focus more on the war and William than before. But thats ok, because I know it's going to all come together in the next book, which I hope is done soon. So looking forward to the tv mini series this spring!

But here it is.  And a very good one at that.  However, this one leaves lots of stories unfinished and the next one is not done yet.  While I appreciate Diana Gabaldon creating masterpieces weaving the stories together, I find I am not sure what to do until the next one comes out.  We will just have to wait.  I am sure it will be worth it

Gabaldon does it again!  What a wonderful series!  The sense of being there makes history come alive.  What fun to turn a corner and run into a historical figure, like Ben Franklin.  Gabaldon's concise use of language and immaculate attention to historical detail never fail.  Thank you, Diana!  Looking forward to many more books from you!

If you are a follower of the Outlander series, this book is terrific and consistent with the characters as they have been developed.  If this is the first book you ever purchased in this series, you are probably wondering what the heck is going on.  Go back to the beginning and read through the proceeding books.  It's worth the journey.

This is one of my favorite series. Clair and Jamie are still in the past, waiting for the american revolution to begin, while their daughter and grandchildren are in the 1980's. You get a look at both of their timelines. Love lives across the world and time itself. I can't wait to see where Gabaldon takes us with the next installment.

Wow! There is so much that happened in this book I can't wait for the next one to come out. There are so many cliff hangers! BUT IT WAS GREAT! I will be reading the next in the series "Written In My Own Hearts Blood" the DAY it goes on sale! If you have read the entire series then you know what I am talking about1 Don't miss this one!

I have not started reading this book yet but it's in the series of the best books I have ever read. (Outlander)  The book came in very good condition so I was lucky to get it so cheap.  I never reviewed a book before so I'm sorry if this lacks information but since I haven't read it yet, what can I say?  I'm sure it will be excellent.

I've just finished reading the entire series yesterday and I now Feel like there is a void in my life. This was hands down the absolute best series I've read in my entire life. Absolutely amazing writing. It has a fantastic love story, lots of action and history, and some steamy parts too! I'd give this book and series 10 if I could.

The Diana Gabaldon Outlander series is wonderful.  Great way to learn some history and get lost in well written novels.  Her attention to detail is wonderful.  You really feel like you are right there.  I've read them several times and each time I read this series I learn something new.  It never gets boring.  All around great read.

Sometimes I feel like I'm reading something like the Dallas series of television, but I don't care.  It is a series that pulls you in and holds tight.  The characters are somewhat superhuman, but I love the human amity of the characters and the philosophy that is interspersed in the text.  Food for the heart and food for thought.

one gets a lot of history along with the entertainment.  I like this book, and will read the 7th book when it becomes available at the library.  as with most of the others, it can ramble, making it easy to skip and still stay with the story.  But none of her Outlander series can match the first Outlander, though they come close.

I absolutely love her detail!  Love following Jamie and Claire through life.  All other characters are as strong and developed as only Diana can do.  I read in amazement her intertwining plots and look forward to where she will take us!  Absolutely the best book series I have ever read - and I have read each book more than once!

This is a great sequel to the other Outlander novels. It's easy to read and brings back all your favorite characters. However, the ending is not an ending! Did not like that aspect of the book. It was not a stand alone novel like the others so left me feeling frustrated. But still a great story like all the others in the series.

This book, as all the books I have read by Gabaldon, was expertly written.  I have read the books at least three times as I enjoy her characters so much.  Each time I read them I find new little nuggets of story that I skipped somehow before.  Thank you Diana Gabaldon for your stories and I look forward to the next installment.

I love to read, and hate when a good read ends. This is especially true now, and I also feel very sad and lost. The Outlander books are by far THE most engaging and challenging novels I have had the pleasure to read. I love the level of detail and complexity of the character development . I feel like I know them all personally.

Like a fine wine The Outlander Series improves "with age"! Not to say the stories and the author are getting old, but they are getting better and better! I especially appreciate the humor and reference to aging bodies of the main characters! I am now deep into Ms. Gabaldon's next book and dread reaching its conclusion.

She's back! And so are Jamie and Claire and everyone else. It's the eve of the American Revolution and , of course, Jamie and Claire are in the thick of it. With sections going to different story lines and times, it's got everything you want in one of her books. I haven't finished it yet, so I don't know if it's truly the end.

I think this is a great story.  As with all long tales there are ups and downs - I think this one redeems some of the downs of the past couple of books.  I enjoy it very very much and am waiting for the final installment this year. And in the meantime I will enjoy whatever else she writes too.  I just love the way she writes.

Gabaldon never disappoints.  Her novels are always exciting, romantic, and surprising.  They are the kinds of books that you just have to say "I can't put it down".  I have read the series 4 times now - it never gets old and I also keep finding stuff that I didn't in the times before.  Can't wait for the next novel!

Some reviewers didn't care for this one because it was more adventure than they could stand.  I loved it because of the adventure! I wont lie and say that I didn't miss having more romance but the characters are so strong and such a part of me now, I don't think I mind much whether they are making love or fighting pirates!

This is a story, the likes of I have never read before. The love between Claire and Jamie is strong and yet they have room to be themselves. The historical part is amazing, as Benjamin Arnold becomes a real person instead of someone you read about.  This is my 7th book and I am not tired of reading this incredible author.

I've loved all of her books and really enjoy reading about the adventures of Jamie and Clare, their family and friends, and all the historical figures they've been involved with over the years. It's always a treat to discover the next plot twist that they have to deal with, and the way their enduring love lasts thru time.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS SERIES I'M IN THE PROCESS OF READING THEM TWICE PREPARING FOR THE NEXT BOOK. IT IS SURPRISING HOW MANY THINGS YOU FORGET. I AM MADLY IN LOVE WITH JAMIE. ANYONE WHO HAS NOT READ THESE BOOKS SHOULD AT LEAST LOOK AT "OUTLANDER" AND SEE IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO READ THAT .TRUST ME YOU WILL BE HOOKED.

The love story continues with love and laughter, blood, sweat and tears. More surprises and twists and turns than you could ever imagine. The love if Jamie and Claire and those who also love them...it's a superbly rich tapestry of love and life. Captured from cover to cover, the most difficult thing is closing the book.

I read this book too quickly the first time, eager to find out what happened. The second time however, I savored every word, and realized how much I missed on the first read. There are so many little nuances and minute details that connect the characters and books together, and if you're not careful, you will miss them.

I have followed this author for many years.  I love reading her books and especially the Outlander series.  I look forward for the next book in the series (and hopefully many more).  The descriptions are vivid enough to feel like I have a movie going on inside my brain as I read.  I would recommend this series of books.

That was my reaction when I finished this book. This one really moves the story of time travel along. But, quite honestly I got tired of reading about William and Lord John. They are not my favorite characters. It's going to be a long wait until the next book is out. In the meantime, I will read them all again, slowly.

I can't believe I've only got book 8 left to read. I've never invested this kind of time and effort in a story. It speaks well of Diana's ability to keep the reader involved and absorbed. It's been an amazing journey reading these marvelous novels. I will now begin book 8 and very much miss the journey when it's done.

Anyone who has enjoyed Diana Gabaldon's previous Outlander novels will recognize the fidelity to character and setting. She has been true to the stories she has already given us while surprising with unexpected new characters and clever twists.  She always leaves me wanting more.  Can't wait to begin the next volume.

This was one of my least favorites in the Outlander series. I found it rather boring many times throughout the book, and was often wishing it would just end. I can't even remember the particulars that bothered me (it's been a few weeks since I completed), but it just wasn't as enjoyable as the others in the series.

The Outlander Series is the best series I've ever read and can't wait for more of the story.  I'm not in to science fiction but this story captured me and has held my interest for years.  I have read and re-read them three times.  The audiobook is fantastic also.  The narrator really captures the dialog perfectly.

Diana Gabaldon's An Echo In The Bone was an exciting, on the edge of your seat read. She did amazing work with this family of characters, to tell their stories, building up to the next sequel of the story.  I could not put this book down and cannot wait for the MOBY (Written In My Own Hearts Blood) to be released.

Another part of the story, I liked it better after reading it the third time and after getting older. I saw the relationships developing as they should between Jamiie and Clair  but I did miss some of the original fire between them, I recommend this book highly to any one and have recommended the series for years

Diana Gabaldon is finally reaching the end of what she can do with this series.  The storyline is beginning to seem contrived.  I enjoy the historical aspect and how she's woven it into the life of the Frasers.  I'm a diehard reader and will read the next book but hope it keeps closer to the original premise.

The entire Diana Gabaldon series about Claire is marvelous, detailed and historically true in many of the details. Fabulous time travel, adventure, love, etc. etc. While reading her books, including this one, I, too, travel in time....no awareness of the 21st century at all! Best escape literature ever read.

I absolutely love this series and this book leaves me counting the days until the next installment is available. Ms. Cabaldon's details and style of story telling is just amazing. Even though anyone would enjoy this book on its own, it would mean so much more to read it in order with the rest of the series.

I have enjoyed the series especially the different points of view and time changes, going back and forth. The main characters are likeable.  I would read the series in order which I did not do the first time.  The second time I ordered everything in order through Kindle and have really liked it this summer.

Can't help it! I love Gabaldon - the way these stories (all Outlander) go just carries you along.  I continue to be impressed with the detail of 18th century medical procedures (as described by Claire Fraser). I've been reading Outlander since 1992, and am a solid fan - of the books, not the new TV series.

I love these books. Just finished this one for the third time, getting ready for the next book, due out in June I think. Diana does a fantastic job with the historical elements in the book, this book takes place during the American Revolution. I wish my history classes in high school were this interesting.

Each book keeps getting better and better. The book was heavy on Lord John Gray and William.  But the Revolutionary War was exciting with Jamie and Claire in the thick of it interacting with George Washington and Benedict Arnold.  The last 100 pages was wil have you on the edge of your seat.  A must read.

I liked this book, but not as much as some of the others. That doesn't mean I disliked it at all. I love the story lines directions and am looking forward to reading the next one. Love the historical references and the endless research that I know was done to create the stories. Thank you, Diana Gabaldon!

How does each book suck one in further than the previous book? Such is the beauty of the latest (but not last) book in the Outlander series. It's been my continuing pleasure to read them all (more than once). Looking forward to when the next one is published in 2014. This cliffhanger has almost killed me!

Of the seven books in the Outlander series, this was both my most & least favorite. The story & descriptions are incredibly vivid in true Gabaldon style, but it was rather rushed, like she was being pressured to meet a deadline. I'd rather wait for her books than feel this sort of hurried accomplishment.

Love the characters, you feel like you are part of their family.  I haven't read one of her books so far that was bad.  You get sci-fi, adventure, historical reinaction, murder, war and a family you want to know and love.  The best part to me is the Scottish history and kinsmanship.  I love these novels.

Diana, I am well pleased with your characters, historical research, and the pace of the storyline.  Keep it up.  I do have one criticism...Jeremiah was NOT the Old Testament prophet sent to Nineveh. Thank you for the deep level of research you have put into each of your writings.  Looking forward to #8!

I've already read the series once. Thought I would read it again before the next one is released. It's even better the second time around using my Kindle. I don't have to worry about a fractured nose if I fall asleep while reading since my Kindle Fire is no where near as heavy as the hardbacks were. ;-)

This series is so well written that every time (and there have been many) I read them it is like seeing an old friend and reminiscing. A must read on many levels. History, romance, true love, family, adventure, characters and a picture painted so well with words that it becomes a true world of reality.

What can I say that has not already been said?  This series will stay with me for a lifetime. I could read and reread throughout my life and never tire of it.  This is probably the 5th time I've read it since it came out. Never gets old. When you have that, it's a treasure worth keeping for a lifetime.

I can't believe I have to wait until March for the next book in Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series! This 7th book in the lineup did not disappoint. I will definitely be going to be going through major withdrawal symptoms for more of Jamie, Claire, Ian, Lord John, Brianna, Roger and the rest of the gang.

Some interesting characters thrown in. Different points of view. All very entertaining and intriguing. However the overall value of the book was probably the worst in the series. It's still one of the best books I've ever read, but my least favorite, shortest one in the series. Embrace the weirdness!!

Absolutely Love this book series!!!  Read all 8 books and will read again for sure.  The emotion is so deep.  Draws the reader into their world until it becomes an obsession...in a good way.  LOVE the relationship between Jamie and Clair, they are a perfect compliment for each other, true soul mates.

I was surprised in reading the mixed reviews for Echo; I really enjoyed it and felt I was among old friends while reading it. There were times I laughed out loud and others that caused a tear or two. I did not find the format troubling or choppy; I agree it is 3 distinct stories, but they are overlapping to me and I saw the interconnectedness of them. I personally enjoyed the endings although 3 yrs will feel like forever to wait to see what she does w/her characters in the next book. I agree that the book was super heavy and I did have to pay attn to how it was supported or I did have wrist pain. Like Jamie and Claire, I am in need of glasses as well! I suggest that if you like the series that you should read the book and form your own opinions as mine does not seem to align w/many of the fellow readers who have posted. This was why I actually did this review, so others might know that not all readers were dissatisfied. I did enjoy the historical links and did look up battles and places discussed in the book and was amazed that the Great Dismal does exist, as I had never heard of it.

Diana is a masterful storyteller and after so many books, I feel like the characters are part of my family.  I waited until the next book came out before tackling this one, and I'm glad I did because there were some cliffhangers at the end.  I went right into the next book when I finished this one.

Just finished the last book in January.  Started the first book in October.  Love the characters.  The pace and story wants the reader to keep turning those pages.  Can't wait for the next one.  I may have to read them again just for fun.  No need to watch TV - this story will keep you entertained.

Another hit! I absolutely love this series! I am on edge waiting for the next book to come out, I have started the series over because I can't wait any longer! Diana is an amazing writer, there is truly something for everyone in her books! I have gotten all my co-workers interested in this series.

This book in the series was my least favorite. With all the letters and politics, while I realize they were laying foundations for future happenings, some of them dragged on a little too long for my taste. I'm not meaning the letters from Jamie and Claire, but the ones from William and John Gray..

I have read the Outlander series from book one and am now waiting to get my hands on her latest book.  She develops her characters so well that I feel like I know them and can't wait to find out what happens.  I can't remember a fiction book series, or even a single book, that I have enjoyed more.

Once I started reading Outlander, the first book in the series; I have eagerly devoured and savored every word. The characters are 3 dimensional and real. They make human errors and overcome tremendous odds. Supporting characters are woven into the plots, appearing, disappearing then reappearing.

It was a great continuation, however like others have said, it does tend to drag a bit during battle/military scenes. The ending though, was so anti climatic and odd. The story just stops with no real rhythm or reason. Hoping story lines are tied up or at least explained in the beginning of MOBY.

I have read all of the Outlander books and found histone the most tedious. I did not care for the heavy focus on William and found it difficult to stay interested in much of the story. The Jamie & Claire parts I read but even some of those were snooze-worthy. Hoping that "Written" will be better.

The series has been quite good on the whole.  There is a major mistake in the middle of the book where she confuses the prophet Jeremiah with the prophet Jonah.  Either the author or her editor should have caught this mistake.  How many other historical mistakes were not caught in final editing.

Diana Gabaldon CANNOT write a weak book!! She has produced another amazing story in the Outlander series, which is the pinnacle of time traveler tales.  The  historical detail is impressive along with all the twists and turns in the plot.  Jamie and Claire's love story never grows stale.  BRAVO

I did like this book, granted, probably not the best of the series but well done anyway. This is an epic adventure for many of it's characters and left me waiting patiently for what could be the final novel in this series. I highly recommend it and wouldn't have missed reading it for the world!

I've been a huge fan of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series ever since I read the first Outlander nearly 20 years ago. This is a great continuation of the story line. Gabaldon's combination of precise historial research and fantasy/romance makes for a great read. It's hard to put this book down.

The story has taken so many twists and turns now that I cannot wait to read the next in the series. All of my favorite characters are hanging above an abyss and I look with great anticipation toward resolution. An Echo in the Bone was suspenseful, funny, tragic, and tender. What's not to love?

The most amazing, enthralling, exciting and captivating books I have ever read. Sophisticated, raw and intelligent writing. Can't wait to start the new book. Had to read the end of this one again to refresh my memory. Looking forward to the stars series coming in August based on these books

I absolutely love this series. All of the books are wonderfully entertaining. This is the second time I have read this series and I found it just as engrossing  as the first time.  Diana Gabaldon has a great gift for story telling. I cannot  wait to read the next installment in this series.

Warning! These books should be read in order. If you read the others in the Outlander series, you will not be disappointed in this one. Gabaldon manages to balance the past and the present creating many twists and turns in the plot to keep us interested and entertained. Happy reading fans.

I felt that the book as a whole was very good, with a lot of historical information, but found it to be very, very wordy.  Which made it much too long.  The author needs to limit her many descriptions of events, etc.  you can only say so much to set the stage of events that are happening.

I have really enjoyed all of her books and this one is no exception.  She writes beautifully and keeps interest all the time.  It does require that one has read at least some of the previous books to keep the characters straight and understand references to past events. Highly recommended

It is as good on the third reading as it was on the first. I cannot wait for the next in the series. I strongly suggest that anyone who wants to read any of the books start with the first and read them in order. You will miss so much if you don't. They definitely build on the ones before.

Another installment of a compelling journey. I find myself tuning out most of the war stuff but there wasn't too much in the first place. I found the medical episodes to be most interesting. It's clear by the end of the book that there's more to the story. It held my interest throughout.

Another rich instalment in the life of Jamie and Claire set against the backdrop of the early years of the American revolution.  The historical facts in this book are great.  As always the special moments to me are the dialogues between Jamie and Claire. I also love Jem.  He is adorable.

This book is a wonderful fantasy read as are all the books in this series!  I can never wait until the next book comes out. Diana Gilbaldon does a good job of researching the history which adds to the story. Have read all the "Outlander" books over the years and would recommend them all!

The entire series is excellent.  I am on book 7.  There are times where it may get a little slow or too much of every day life, but still one of the best series I have read.  I thought the whole idea of the time travel would not keep my interest but it is very interesting.  A MUST READ!

This book (in the series) expands the family.  It is interesting with lots of adventure.  A little long with the historical  war details but it all plays into the story.  Each book moves you along the the timeline progression as it relates to the family and  aquaintences of the Frasers.

Love the series, so I bad to keep reading, however this one does get dull with drawn out war details. I still live the characters and the introduction of secrets of from people in previous books. As always, looking forward to the next book, and happy that Jamie and Claire are still one.

really enjoyed seeing what Clare and Jamie's next adventure would be.  Enjoyed reading about Clares management of infection and medical conditions in the back country of Fraser's Ridge and with the passage of Bree and Roger through the stones.  Looking forward to reading the next book,

I was unable to put the book down. The characters are strong. The detail expands my knowledge of the times,the dangers and the politics.  I marvel at the authors ability to maintain the readers attention. I wonder what I will feel when the story ends.  I've ordered the Lord John books.

As any reader of Diana Gabaldon knows by now, her books are long and filled with detail.  This is no exception as this story again weaves and twists from the past and present and the here and there.  I enjoyed this book even though it took a bit longer to read than some of her others.

There is not a book that Diana Gabaldon has written that has not been amazing and wonderful.  I can't say enough about her books.  DG draws you in to this story.  It almost feels like family.  The adventure and romance is sweeping and enthralling.  Read her books!  You won't be sorry.

Hard to put down, and I've read it before! Started to reread the series in December and found myself seeing much deeper into the story.  Can't wait for the next book. I hope she writes more follow up about Michael and Joan either in the next book or one of their own! Love her writing!

Always fun to see how this yarn keeps winding and unwinding.  It's kind of like unravelling genealogy, only a bit backwards, since they know some of their ancestors.  Totally enjoyed this book.  Lots of fun turns and twists.  Great character description and development.  A great read!

I was so pleased to get my hands on another OUTLANDER book, I could hardly stand it! As usual, I could not put it down.  However, since it had been so long since I had read the last one, I'm going back and will re-read the 2 before AN ECHO IN THE BONE before I start on the next one.

This series is excellent, especially this novel! No other author can immerse me so fully into a story. Gabaldon really does her research on historical events and norms. The adventure in this novel is unparalleled and I am head over heels in love with the characters she has created.

Honestly, I thoroughly enjoyed this book. However, I got a little confused with sometimes the story was of Claire speaking, and other times Claire was referred to in the third person. I was very captivated by the short chapters. Hopefully the next book ties up a lot of loose ends.

My favorite one so far in the series!  Lots of surprizes as usual and fast paced reading.  More American history in this one that brings back our own Country's beginning both good and bad.  She gives you the feeling that you are there - great historical story telling at it's best.

Even though these books have a tendency to go on and on, once you're hooked, you're hooked.  The characters and the stories are superb.  Though I find Claire and Jamie's constant lovemaking a trifle unbelievable considering their ages.  But maybe that's a benefit of time travel?!

Fabulous book series with vibrant characters, vivid scenery and accurate historic detail.  Once you start reading this series you will not want to put it down.  The characters become friends.  Start with "Outlander" though as this one is several books into the story line.

I love this series of Outlander books. The history is fascinating and I especially like all the characters. They are real people caught in an unreal situation. If you haven't read the previous books this one may be confusing because it constantly refers to the previous stories.

The saga continues. I'm so wrapped up with this family it isn't funny. The books are so well written, I feel like I've been with them for years. I feel for them and all the things the family has been through. I can't wait to see if there is another book after I finish this one.

Was a little worried as I saw some negative reviews but found this book to be just as good as the other sequels. Many people who love the series with find this one to a great continuation of A Breath of Snow and Ashes! Cant wait for 8 but will have to do with The Exile for now!

I really like this series and can't wait for the next book to come out in June.  Have it already pre-ordered. I like the way she puts a little of the history of the times and weaves the different people back and forth in the books.  Will read her other books!!!!  Great author.

Having just finished the 2nd reading of the Outlander series, I can only say without doubt, there will be a 3rd. Diane Gabaldon's characters are real, her phrasing is funny and gut-wrenching at the same time, and the history lessons are better than 20 years of classroom study!

Within the last 6 months I began reading the Outlander series and had read all the books written to date except this one.  I simply am enthralled by the series and knew Gabaldon was writing another in the series to be published in the first half of 2014.  I wanted to be ready!

It is most difficult yo maintain a series like this & the author does an admirable job. The explanations of past events is briefer but four stars instead of five because there is any explanation. If readers want the back story let them do as I have done. Read the other books.

Recommend reading ALL 8 books. They are amazing stories of these characters lives against the backdrop of historical events yet are so much more than that. Both turbulent, gut wrenching, bittersweet and poignant.  I'm on the last book and will be sorry to take leave of them.

This book is in good conditions I can't wait till I get the book before it read so I can get to it. If you have not read any of her books you should start with the Outlander its about ancient stone circle a doorway that opens a English women meets a eighteenth-century Scott.

The seventh in the Outlander series deals with the Revolutionary War, its danger and tension in the American colonies.  Friends and relatives find themselves on opposing sides and  now multiple plots deal with not only Jamie and Claire, but with satellite families as well.

I absolutely devoured all 7 of the books in this series! Thank goodness there is an eighth book coming out in 2014. This last book left too many events hanging! I've preordered the 8th book! I can't wait until I can get back into this well-written, historical fiction book!

The vivid detail in this book (in fact the entire series) is fabulous. This author paints the story so that you feel you are "first person". I have read all these books in the Outlander series and cannot say enough for how well written they are. Don't miss out....

The books in Gabaldon's Outlander Series are more enjoyable when read in sequence.  I read this one after reading her first two books.  Although I enjoyed the exciting action, some aspects were confusing as I had missed the introduction of certain characters and events.

Hoping that Diana is writing a sequel.  I now have the entire set on my kindle and ipad.  My hardcopies have been passed along to so many other readers that I feel like a library ~ everyone has loved the series!  Only complaint ~ that there won't be a "next one"

This is another great tale of Claire and Jamie, their extended family and friends.  All of the twists and turns and intertwining of the characters are both unexpected and highly entertaining.  I am starting Book 8 and will be so sad to end my time with these families.

Diana writes down to earth stories that grab you at the beginning and don't let you go till THE END.  Characters 'feel natural real-life' situations help me get a good picture of how things were back in that far-off time.  I have read all of this series....I LIKE IT!

I've grown to love the characters in the Outlander series, and this book is as good as it gets.  (I have been reading this series since June when a friend recommended THE VOYAGER to me and not one book has disappointed me.)  Diana, keep writing, your gift is amazing!

I'm sad to say that I didn't really enjoy this book so much as the others in the series.it felt more disjointed and unfinished compared to the others. I'm hoping when the next one comes out it will start by tying up these loose ends before diving into the next story

I have read all her books, she is truly amazing how she involves you with her characters. I started with outlander in the 80's, an wait breathlessly for each new nook to appear.  I read the whole series every 2 yrs. in the summer time. It's my favorite summer read.

Diana Gabaldon at her best. Contiuation of the story of Jaimie and Claire. This book belongs in the Outlander series. Excellent story. A must read if you are into the history of Scotland and England, told with a twist and a romance. A must read.. the entire series!

I loved this book as I did all the others. A few months after reading it, as with all DG"S books, I was longing for more. So I started over. I re-read the entire series. It was as wonderful and fascinating as the first time I read them. Can't wait for the next one.

An Echo in the Bone is one of the best books in the Outlander series having several related story lines happening simultaneously.  Of course, you need to read the six books prior to truly understand everything that happens in Book 7.  Thoroughly enjoy this one.

Somehow diana Gabaldon can write several stories at the same time, including 3 time periods at the same time.  And never once mixes up the reader.  The children she writes are magnificent.  And somehow 1968 versus 1760 translates into a story of unusual beauty.

Diana Gabaldon is an awesome story teller.  The Outlander Series is the best I have ever read.  She draws you into the story and the characters come alive.  I regret that I am just about finished with the series.  I may have to start over and enjoy them again.

A bountiful banquet that satisfies my appetite for adventure, romance, history, travel, culture, philosophy, spirituality, medicine and so much more!  Diana Gabaldon writes in manner that is visionary and relevant.  Can't wait for the Starz Series this summer!

Diana's Outlander series defies description other than incredible writing and storytelling. For those who love big sweeping stories across place and time and aren't afraid of hefty books (hard copy) or long reads (kindle) this book and the series are for you!

I have been reading this series for 20 years and it is one of my guilty pleasures.  I wish Gabaldon would stick to the adventures and lighten up on the sex.  Wonderful historical fiction - unbelievable as it is - but the romance part makes we want to scream.

I've never read a book that deprives my sleeping hours a lot until I start reading Diana's book. Once I started reading 2 or 3 pages I just can't put it down. The story is so intriguing and exciting. Well written books!!  I hope Diana continue to write more.

A terrific series.  I can't wait to finish the 8 books.  Full of history, love, and fighting.  Completely captivating and I loose all sense of time while reading Ms. Gabaldon's books.  If you've read The Glassblower then you'll definitely love this series.

Really enjoyed all the books but far too long and boring. Have to skim read to get through them as not interesting enough to read every word. Most of the time I'm thinking - who cares, what's that to do with the story. Poor old Roger - what a disappointing character and the best thing - his voice  - she took away from him. Can't imagine what her editor is doing not cutting it back - half the size would be good. Written equivalent of 'the runs'. Agree with all the other comments re Lord John - boring character and certainly won't be reading those books. Jamie was too good to be true and found myself actually being irritated by him at times - strange.

This, the seventh book of the series, was another great reading adventure with Claire and Jamie Fraser. I am always happy to find that each individual book, is a stand alone novel. And even if you have not read the other books it is still a great read!

I know it's cliche to say I couldn't put this book down, but I literally resented anything that made me stop reading. Spoiler alert!!! When Jaime shows up at Lord Grey's home, I whooped so loud I scared my 2 year old son. I highly recommend this book.

This series will be in the literature classes of colleges and Universities across the country very soon, if it's not already.  For professors who want to show students how it is done, this series has it all.  The quality of the writing is unsurpassed!

I just re-read the whole series as I was waiting for "Written in my own heart's blood" to arrive. This book was better than ever and now my new book arrived today. I can take up the story fresh as a daisy. I can't wait for the Starz series!!!

Another wonderful book. I am going to be so sad when I finish the series.  The characters in her books stay with me day and night; I will miss them.  Of course I will try other stories by Diana Gabaldon; I can only hope they will keep me so riveted.

I've been a fan of this series since a friend introduced me to it in 1997. Each time a new book comes out (since Drums), I read them all again, as well as other times when it's just been too long since I've visited my dear friends Jamie and Claire.

As usual, loved it... was better than reviews I read gave it. However, that being said.... it seemed to move at a weird pace of stop & go back. There's a lot left to be answered, more than when this book begins.... Looking forward to the next book.

Best series I have ever read, love the books, love Claire and Jamie's and all their family stories. Love Ian and John and all the extra stories aside from the main story. But I guess with CJR Diana has done a great job in making us hat the villain

If you're not a Jamie and Claire fan yet, I suggest you become one right away. Of course, start with "Outlander," Gabaldon's first book of the series. You'll be hooked. BTW, they're currently filming "Outlander" for a STARZ series.

While the historical portion of the American Revolutionary War was fascinating, the ending of the book was just too abrupt.  It was as if the writer needed a place to stop to save the remainder of the story for the next book, so she just stopped!

An excellent book.  I could not stop reading it.  I wanted to start another book after reading this one but had to read the seventh and last book in the Outlander Series.  I would highly recommend it to anyone who is reading the Outlander Series.

This is the first time I have read the novel and I believe  it may just be the best yet. I have  read them all through for the second time. Except for this one of course. I do see myself reading it again at some point. Such a wonderful series!!!!

Absolutely wonderful book!  Keeps you on the edge of your seat wanting more.  Love the historical details and all the characters -  Jamie, Claire, Roger, Bree, Ian, Ferguson, Marsali, William, Lord John.  Each chapter is as exciting as the last!

I loved this book and all the books before it.  They keep you totally intrigued and you cannot stop reading.  An Echo in the Bone was an on the edge of your seat read.  The characters are like family and I hope there are many more books to come.

An excellent follow up to her previous book, the excitement does not stop. In fact, it increases at almost a harrowing speed. My only reason for the rating was the cliffhanger. So many story lines left hanging, that I thought it was a bit much.

I absolutely love the Outlander series and couldn't wait to get the new book. I have read the others so many times that they are falling apart.  I just don't see myself re-reading Echo.  I loved that William was a large part of the story but there was too much wartime detail with all the Generals, Corporals, etc. and it was easily skipped over without losing any part of the continuing story.  And, how much bad luck can one person (Jamie) have for God's sake. It has gotten old.  My biggest propblem, BIG SPOILER COMING HERE....................is that the character's we have all fell in love with acted very out of character in many scenes, especially Claire and John's activities in bed.  We have been led to believe that the love Claire and Jamie share is so huge and special, yet he is wrongly thought dead for what a whole 3 days and they jump in the sack?????  I don't think so.  The unfinished stories are no big deal to me because I am left feeling very unfulfilled by the entire book. Four stars........yes, but only because I love to read about Jamie Fraser so much.

I wavered as to whether i was going to read this one or not, based on other reviews, and debated my choice about 1/3 of the way through, but it gained momentum and i loved it just like all the others!  Couldnt wait to dive into number eight!!!

I waited years for this novel to carry on the Outlander series. Gabaldon is as brilliant as ever. I just hope after Jamie and Claire's children,  Gabaldon continues through the lives of their children's children. May it not end in my lifetime.

One thing I particularly like about the way this series is is written is how the author weaves facts from other books into the newest book to maintain continuity. Just when I hit a spot and wonder about a past event mentioned, it is explained.

When a favorite author has a new book in the series I always start from the beginning. Always find new things that I must of rushed by or just remember differently. I love this series and now I get to go forward to the new addition can't wait

Love the first six books in the Outlander series: This one though too much war, all about Jamie's son. Not enough of Jamie and Claire. Bit long winded. Seems like the main plot line has almost run out.  Do love the series on Starz TV though.

Please remove from pending list.  I order too many books to review each.  Additionally, individual's tastes differ and my opinion of a book should have no bearing on anyone elses.  If enough people like it, it will make the best seller list.

Diana Gabaldon is a brilliant author. Her novels have taught me to appreciate history and have sparked a need to know more. If you have never read a book by her, I highly recommend that you read Outlander. Be prepared for an amazing journey.

But in order to really understand this book you must have read the prior books in the series.  I am re-reading it for the 2nd time in anticipation of the next book coming out in 2013 (I hope).  I highly recommend the entire Outlander series.

I have loved this whole series! Diane Gabaldon is a remarkable writer. I have been intrigued throughout the series and could not wait to read what was coming next. This series has kept me wanting more and more. A most exciting book/series!

Claire and Jamie's story continues as they grow older and the family grows larger.  Life's struggles and moments of discovery develop their story toward it's conclusion in Book 8.  However, it's still a page-turner so enjoy...............

Unfortunately, this felt more like a bridge between novels than her previous works. Don't get me wrong.. I'm a complete fan of the Outlander series. I own them all, and have read them more than once. But this one... nah, I wasn't charmed.

I can't name one character, other than Jamie and Claire, who are my favorites. I so enjoy each persons story & anticipate the way it plays into history & the other extended families. An amazing writer. I recommend this series to everyone!

It is just a lovely writhen series with both historical facts and a credible fantasy that build up the story. I recommend it to everyone that will read about Scottish and American 18 century history in a light fiction way, Jonny S. Nordén

I've eaten my way through the Outlander series over the last few months.  This one has a painful cliffhanger, but I'm sure it will resolve (it better!)  Diana Gabaldon is a fantastic author and I'm so glad I finally started this series.

I definitely recommend this book to those following the series. It lives up to the same high standards of her previous books, always making it impossible to put down. The characters are true to form leaving us the readers wanting more.

I had read these books before but did not read the last two.  Now I wait for the next due out in 2014. These books are a wonderful history of Scotland written in novel form but follows the history of the Scots.  I enjoyed it verra much

Loved this book.  The entire series is pretty close to being addictive.  I can't wait to get to the next book, then the next. Diana Gabaldon draws you in with her storyline and characters.  This is a collection that I will read again.

I love all of her books and have read all but the last book.  I bought the last book and will start reading it tomorrow.  She has such a fantastic imagination and all the characters live in all her books-- the important family anyway.

I absolutely love how Diana Gabaldan is letting us watch Jamie and Claire spend their time while growing older. Most stories don't allow the reader to see the real life of the characters and I love the life the author has let us view.

If you haven't read this series, start at the beginning.  I love the deep characters, the history it follows, the twists and turns.  It's all amazing.  I've moved on to the new book.  LOVE LOVE LOVE IT. (It's really 10 stars out of 5)

Another great volume in the Outlander series.  Diana Gabaldon's creative mind has succeeded agsin. Another page turner and impossible to put down!  The historical aspects add so much to the story and make it all the more interesting.

A delight as I've come to expect for Gabaldon! A steady shifting of story-line, and character narrative keeps this addition to the series collective from becoming monotonous or a drawing read, like some other Author's book series do.

A cliff hanger that compelled me to buy Written in My Own Heart'c Blood before I could put my Kindle down.  My reading adventure has been nonstop since Outlander and has been continuous through all 7 books up to and including Book 8.

I have read all of the Outlander books including this one.  I have just bought Book 8 and am looking forward to reading that one.  I believe it is the final book, but hope not.  I am sure I shall read more of Diana Gabaldon's books.

There is no match in the literary world of sci-fi, romance, historical fiction for Diana Gabaldon.  She writes with authoritative, creative vigor that I've yet to see matched anywhere.  The Outlander series is well worth your time.

Some moments were brilliant!  Some not so much but still a really good book.  How could you say no to Jamie Fraser anyway.  I enjoyed Ian and Rachel's story immensely.  Very interesting aspects of life during the Revolutionary War!

I devour the Outlander series. Every book is my new favorite.  The characters become so real I never want the books to end I just want more.  I am rereading this book to be prepared for the new book in the series before I start it.

I love all her books and wait and wait for the next one in the series.  Her books are so well written and you fall in love with all her characters and even learn a bit of history.  Start from the first book in the series and enjoy.

Out of the whole wonderful series of the OUTLANDER books, this last one left you completely hanging about what happened to all of the major characters, Brianna, Roger, Jamie and Claire???!!!  Is there any other book in this series?

Great continuation of the Jamie & Claire Saga, moved a little slow in parts, brought back some characters from the past & tied up a few loose ends, but based on the story lines it set up, I expect a lot of action in the next book.

The entire Outlander Series is a must read (in order!). Once you start, you are hooked. It's hard to wait for the next one, but that gives you time to reread and rediscover new things you might have missed the first time through.

I would've thought by now I would be tired of the outlander series but I'm totally addicted. This one was bittersweet.. Everyone is moving on but some of the twists keep you wanting more.  I can' t wait for the new book in June.

Diana Gabaldon doesn't disappoint! Follow Claire and Jamie's story into the American Revolution, Roger and Bree and kids in Scotland, and Young Ian finally finding love. Be ready for a roller coaster of emotions while you read!

I have read and listened to this series numerous times. My favorite books of all time. I am completely obsessed! All of us need a Jamie. Make sure to watch "Outlander" TV series. This is one of the books in that series.

I have read and reread all the books in this series too many times to count and I love them more each time. The characters are so real that I feel like I know them personally and love them dearly. I can't wait for the next one!

This book picks up the pace that had slowed in the last book. I read it much faster and it covers many more characters as the familie's adventures grow. By the end, I could not put it down and was eager to start the next book!

I love that older people (in their 50 and 60s!) are shown as desirable, sexual beings.  These books have everything - history, romance, medicine, religion, science fiction.  Very excited for the new one coming out next month!

One of the best written and exciting series ever! Time traveling, set both in the 1940s and the 1770s. So much excellent and interesting detail, memorable characters, humorous, realistic, heart breaking. You won't regret it.

What can I say? It's an Outlander book by Gabladon! Her characters echo down the history of the 18th century, keeping everyone in love with Jamie and fascinated by Claire. I'll read them all, and then I'll read them again.

Gabaldon does not disappoint in book seven of the series. There are some surprises, endings, and further development of some characters. I thoroughly enjoyed it. A must read as are all of the books in the Outlander series.

This book was exciting and hard to put down.  Ms. Gabaldon is a terrific story teller.  Her characters seem to be real and  Ms. Gabaldon brings the reader into the story as a viewer of the action instead of just a reader.

What an enjoyable series of love, courage, time travel, commitment.  Never such a great set of stories!  Everybody loves Claire, Jamie, & all the characters in this series.  Love Diane's writing and history storytelling!!

It can be hard to keep all the characters and their relationships correctly in my head, but the movements throughout the book made sense according to what we know about each person, and that's what makes it work so well.

I cannot stop reading through this series of Diana's - full of every adventure, ever changing dynamics of life, history, war and some romance. The reader is drawn in to the story along side the characters. Transforming.

I waited months to read this book and I loved it.Diana Does it again. She has such a way with words it's indescribable. It's as if you are right there viewing what you're reading. Omg I can't wait to read the next book.

This is one of the best historical novel series that I have ever read.  The intricate details of the past are mixed with fascinating personalities. The books are long, but now make everything else I read seem too short.

I'm totally in love with Jamie and can't bear for these books to end. Lovuoo the details of revolutionary war which hasn't been written about much in novels. Think Diana dies great with weaving n storytelling. Magical.

Anyone who loved the first books of Ms Gabaldon's will love this one as well. The original characters remain true to themselves and to one another. Hard to explain the affection that grows for each of them across time.

Diana Gabaldon is a suburb author. Her ability to illustrate and bring words to life is brilliant! I have thoroughly enjoyed every page of this series. I encourage anyone reading my review to read the outlander series!

It had a very slow start, I had to put it down many times to regain interest.. The story was amazing and Diana did a great job at once again surprising us.. I love this series and I hope Jamie and Claire live forever!

I enjoy diana's alternate universe as I do Stephen king novels. Her ability to describe in minute detail sights sounds and smells puts me right in the middle of it all living and breathing. Thank you for such a gift!!

When you read this book and ALL of Diana's books you can FEEL, TOUCH, SMELL & TASTE the words.  If this isn't the realm of a great author then I don't know what is.  I sit patiently for her NEXT novel to be published.

The negative reviewers don't get it.  Having read all the Outlander books, this one brings past and present together in only the way Gabaldon can.  The ending is crazy amazing and leaves you in anticipation for more!

Really I,m still reading it...unlike the other books ,I'm having trouble getting thru this one the story is hard to follow and truly, I have been very busy at work and falling to sleep when i'm trying to read it....

I have absolutely loved this series...until now.  Like other reviewers, I reached the end of the novel (read on my Kindle) and couldn't believe it was ending.  It felt like the entire purpose of this novel was to set up the next novel.  Normally, I wouldn't mind, but so much time passes between each edition that I fear that I'll forget what happened. Of course, I could just read the last two hundred pages over again and be caught up, since that is where ALL of the action occurs.  If she weren't so busy working on the Lord John novels in between, we could wrap up this series. Overall, I was very disappointed this time around, however, given that I'm several novels into a series, I'll have to finish it out when the time comes (if I don't die of old age first!).

This is the seventh book in the Claire and Jamie story and for those who've read the first six it is a must of course. There are many interesting revelations about past mysteries. Besides Claire and Jamie the story is told from Brianna's and Roger's and Ian's viewpoints but this time also William and Lord John are among the main characters. In some parts it feels more like one of the Lord John novels and characters, who have only been introduced in the Lord John books, feature in this novel. In the first half of the book, the story seems to unfold quite slowly, but then it gathers strength and the different storylines come together. At the end of the book many things are left open and in suspense, so you know for sure that this is not the last book. It is a little disconcerting to think that you have to wait a couple of years before you get to know what will happen. As all the Diana Gabaldon fans already know the book is filled with laughter and tears as well as intense romance, excitement, wit and detailed historic facts.
